Discrete Mathematics

Indistinguishable Boxes and Distinguishable Objects

DM
Oct 19, 2020

Stirling Number (of the second kind) $S(n, j)$ denotes the number of ways $n$ distinguishable objects could be distributed in $j$ indistinguishable boxes.

Distinguishable Boxes and Distinguishable Objects

DM
Oct 18, 2020

Number of ways to distribute $n$ distinguishable objects in $k$ distinguishable boxes such that there are $n_i$ objects in box $i=1, 2, \dots k$ equals
